author: Tom Brant
title: New Gameband Smartwatch Comes With Pong, Terraria | News & Opinion
text:
Nintendo's upcoming Switch console is great for gamers on the go, especially those who are also Zelda fans, but what if you want the opportunity to play even more classic games in an even more portable package?
Enter Gameband , a Kickstarter project billing itself as the world's first smartwatch built for gamers. The $199 Android Wear-based watch will come with cherished titles including Asteroids, Pong, Breakout, Centipede, and Crystal Classics, reengineered to take advantage of a smartwatch's motion tracking capabilities.
The project is headed up by former Apple and Lenovo Exec Feargal Mac Conuladh, and backed by Qualcomm, whose Snapdragon Wear 2100 processor will power the Gameband. It's the same processor that powers the new $349 LG Watch Sport , which Google called "Android Wear's most powerful watch."
